item.title: Updated credential and authentication information.
item.description: Updated credential and authentication method instructions and examples. This includes updating relevant Getting started pages and configuration pages. To accommodate this increase in documentation, relevant credential topics were moved to the new Authentication and access credentials section.

item.title: Token provider configuration with automatic authentication refresh for AWS IAM Identity Center added
item.description: The new process to configure the AWS CLI to authenticate users with AWS IAM Identity Center (IAM Identity Center) using the SSO token provider configuration, which can automatically retrieve refreshed authentication tokens.

item.title: Official Amazon ECR Public image for the AWS CLI version 2 released
item.description: The official supported Amazon ECR Public image for the AWS CLI version 2 is released for Linux, macOS, and Windows.

item.title: Updated the guide for migrating from AWS CLI V1 to V2
item.description: Expanded the breaking changes guide to include migration instructions to going from AWS CLI version 1 to the AWS CLI version 2. Includes updates to the Troubleshooting page to help with installation issues.

item.title: New process to build a AWS CLI installer from source.
item.description: New process to install or update from source to the latest release of the AWS CLI on supported operating systems.

item.title: Content for the AWS CLI V1 and V2 are now separated into their respective guides
item.description: For clarity and ease, the AWS CLI version 1 and AWS CLI version 2 content is now separated into their own guides. For AWS CLI version 1, see the AWS CLI version 1 User Guide.

item.title: Added AWS CLI alias information
item.description: Added AWS CLI alias information. Aliases are shortcuts you can create in the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI) to shorten commands or scripts that you frequently use.

item.title: Updated filter output information
item.description: Updated information for filters and moved to their own page.

item.title: Added information for Wizards
item.description: Added AWS CLI version 2 wizard information.

item.title: Updated auto-prompt
item.description: Updated the AWS CLI version 2 auto-prompt information with current features.

item.title: Added Amazon S3 scripting example
item.description: Added an Amazon S3 lifecycle scripting example.

item.title: Added Amazon EC2 scripting example
item.description: Added an Amazon EC2 instance type scripting example.

item.title: Added retries information
item.description: Added a retries page for features and behavior of retries in the AWS CLI.

item.title: Server-side and client-side pagination page
item.description: Updated pagination information and centralized on a single page.

item.title: Updated s3 commands page
item.description: Updated the high-level s3 commands page with new examples and resources.

item.title: Updated installation information
item.description: The install, update, and uninstall information for Linux, macOS, and Windows are updated.

item.title: Added information for text file encoding on the AWS CLI version 2
item.description: By default, AWS CLI version 2 uses the same text file encoding as the local. You can now use environment variables to set text file encoding.

item.title: Official Docker image for the AWS CLI version 2 released
item.description: The official support Docker image for the AWS CLI version 2 is released for all Linux, macOS, and Windows.

item.title: Added information regarding client-side pagers for AWS CLI version 2
item.description: By default, AWS CLI version 2 uses the pager program less for all client-side output.

item.title: AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI) Version 2 is officially released
item.description: The AWS CLI version 2 is generally available and is the recommended version for customers to install.

item.title: macOS installer for AWS CLI version 2 is now an Apple Package installer .pkg file.
item.description: The macOS installer for AWS CLI version 2 has been updated from a .zip file with a shell script to full macOS Installer package. This simplifies installation and makes it compatible with the newest macOS releases.

item.title: Added content for AWS CLI version 2's improved default handling of S3 and STS Regional endpoints
item.description: By default, AWS CLI version 2 now directs requests for the Amazon S3 and AWS STS services to the currently configured Regional endpoint instead of the global endpoint.

item.title: Developer preview release for AWS CLI version 2
item.description: Announcing preview release of AWS CLI version 2. Added instructions about installing version 2. Add Migration topic to discuss differences between versions 1 and 2.

item.title: Added support for AWS IAM Identity Center to AWS CLI named profiles
item.description: AWS CLI version 2 adds support for creating a named profile that can directly login to IAM Identity Center and get AWS temporary credentials for use in subsequent AWS CLI commands.

item.title: New MFA section
item.description: Added a new section describing how to access the CLI using multi-factor authentication and roles.

item.title: Update to "Using the CLI" section
item.description: Major improvements and additions to the usage instructions and procedures.

item.title: Update to "Installing the CLI" section
item.description: Major improvements and additions to the AWS CLI installation instructions and procedures.

item.title: Update to "Configuring the CLI" section
item.description: Major improvements and additions to the AWS CLI configuration instructions and procedures.
